title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Test Automation
description: Develop the next generation of assessments using leading technologies. Work with innovative agile teams using the full stack to solve remote testing security problems.
htmlDescription:
About the Role

In this role, you'll develop the next generation of assessments using leading technologies. You'll work with innovative agile teams using the full stack to solve remote testing security problems.

Responsibilities of the Role

  • Collaborate on software projects with product design and technical teams
  • Develop, test, release, and maintain back-end services, front-end applications, and AWS infrastructure
  • Work as a technical contributor on an Agile team

Qualifications needed for the role

  • BA/BS required (major in an analytical field desired)
  • A minimum of 5 years' work related experience
  • Advanced experience working with Node.js, AWS, Typescript/Javascript, NoSQL database (DynamoDB)
  • Advanced experience in implementing serverless applications on AWS
  • Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment
  • Experience working on Agile engineering teams
  • Experience in doing pair programming with fellow engineers
  • Some experience working in Python

Preferred Skills and Attributes for the Role

  • Ability to perform in multiple roles on a team, including testing and production support as well as development
  • Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving ability
  • Experience using libraries and frameworks where it makes sense, while still understanding how each line in your codebase works
  • Willingness to work on QA and develop test automation scripts and participate in code reviews
  • Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively in a cross-functional team environment
  • Ethos of continuous improvement and interest in learning new things
  • Strong ability to understand and internalize the big picture and broader implications
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skill with the ability to work with a diverse set of colleagues, across functions, from different organizations, disciplines, etc.
  • Self-starter, ability to set priorities, work independently and attain goals
  • AWS Certified (Associate or higher)
requirements: BA/BS required (major in an analytical field desired)
A minimum of 5 years' work related experience
Advanced experience working with Node.js, AWS, TypeScript/JavaScript, NoSQL database (DynamoDB)
Advanced experience in implementing serverless applications on AWS
Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment
Experience working on Agile engineering teams
Experience in doing pair programming with fellow engineers
Some experience working in Python

Work as a technical contributor on an Agile team

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Serverless
description: Develop and implement full stack AWS Cloud solutions and continuous delivery frameworks. Build infrastructure as code and work with immutable cloud-based environments.
htmlDescription: Develop and implement full stack AWS Cloud solutions and continuous delivery frameworks. Build infrastructure as code and work with immutable cloud-based environments. Responsible for quality assurance and continuous improvement processes.
requirements: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or MIS
5-7 years of experience in software systems, programming, database development, and infrastructure development and administration
Minimum 5 years demonstrated experience with full stack development
3+ years demonstrated experience with AWS cloud supported programming languages like JavaScript, Node.js, React.js
2+ years hands-on with AWS Lambda, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, EC2, RDS and DynamoDB, AWS CLI
2+ years hands-on building infrastructure as code using AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit) and CloudFormation
Fluency with CI/CD toolsets such as: Jenkins, Ansible, CloudFormation, BitBucket
Working knowledge of AWS Serverless architecture
Working knowledge of distributed architectural design patterns
qualifications: Develop and implement solutions based on standards, patterns and processes
Build full stack AWS Cloud solutions and continuous delivery frameworks
Write complex code, building infrastructure as code, work with immutable cloud-based environments
Create design specifications, unit testing, and prepare technical documentation
Drive continuous improvement of team efficiency, speed, and quality
preferredSkills: Expertise in programming languages, relational databases, and NoSQL databases
Familiarity with monitoring tool suites like DataDog, SumoLogic, NewRelic, and Nagios
Experience with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments
Strong practical Linux based systems administration skills and scripting experience
Experience with automated testing tools (i.e. selenium, Cucumber)
Experience with Agile Scrum practice
experience: 5-7 years of full stack development experience

title: Database Systems Specialist
description: Maintain, enhance, and ensure smooth operation of Document Management System (DMS) and Portal. Expertise in ASP.NET, SQL Server, and JAVA required.
htmlDescription:
Software Developer & Database Systems Specialist

Position Overview:We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Developer and Database Systems Specialist to join our team at the Public Service Commission (PSC). The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and ensuring the smooth operation of our existing Document Management System (DMS) and Portal. This role requires expertise in ASP.NET, SQL Server, and JAVA, as well as strong proficiency in database management and system administration.

Responsibilities:

  1. SQL Server Database Maintenance:Perform all DMS-related SQL Server database maintenance tasks, including backups, corruption detection and fixing, index rebuilding, and management of data and transaction log files. Monitor and maintain system services to optimize performance and ensure data integrity.
  2. Cloud Migration:Collaborate with the PSC IT Division to migrate on-premise servers to cloud-based servers. Ensure seamless functionality of the DMS and Portal on the latest cloud-based platforms.
  3. Software Development:Design, develop, and deploy ASP.NET and JAVA code applications for online services such as e-filing, case and docket searches, public proceedings agendas, hearing schedules, and official filings. Implement coding updates, enhancements, and modifications to DMS functionality as specified by the PSC IT Division.
  4. Coordination and Collaboration:Coordinate with the PSC IT Division for updates, enhancements, and modifications to DMS functions. Work closely with other IT staff and designated cloud service providers to ensure smooth operation of the DMS.

Skills and Technologies Required:

  • Expertise in SQL Server database maintenance and administration on Windows Server.
  • Proficiency in ASP.NET and JAVA for designing and deploying online services applications.
  • Strong understanding of database management principles and system administration.
  • Experience with cloud migration projects and familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot database and system issues effectively.
  • Effective communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
requirements: Expertise in SQL Server database maintenance and administration on Windows Server
Proficiency in ASP.NET and JAVA for designing and deploying online services applications
Strong understanding of database management principles and system administration
Experience with cloud migration projects and familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS)
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot database and system issues effectively
Effective communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
qualifications: Perform all DMS-related SQL Server database maintenance tasks, including backups, corruption detection and fixing, index rebuilding
Collaborate with the PSC IT Division to migrate on-premise servers to cloud-based servers
Design, develop, and deploy ASP.NET and JAVA code applications for online services
Coordinate with the PSC IT Division for updates, enhancements, and modifications to DMS functions
preferredSkills: Experience with Document Management Systems
Knowledge of government IT systems and compliance requirements
Experience with Windows Server administration
Familiarity with e-filing and case management systems
experience: 3+ years of database systems and software development experience

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - CMS
description: Develop systems for handling new user registration and onboarding for large enterprise initiatives. Support production releases that impact millions of users.
htmlDescription:
Summary

In this role, you'll develop systems for handling new user registration and onboarding for large enterprise initiatives and support production releases that impact millions of users.

In this role, you will:

  • Collaborate on software projects with product design and technical teams
  • Develop, test, release, and maintain back-end services, front-end applications, and infrastructure
  • Work as a technical contributor on an Agile team

Qualifications needed for the role:

  • BA/BS required (major in an analytical field desired)
  • A minimum of 5 years' work related experience
  • Advanced experience working with Node.js in an AWS environment. Intermediate experience with React, and relational databases like PostgreSQL, or noSQL (such as DynamoDB)
  • Experienced implementing serverless applications on AWS
  • Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment
  • Experience working on Agile engineering teams

Preferred skills:

  • Ability to perform in multiple roles on a team, including testing and production support as well as development
  • Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving ability
  • Experience using libraries and frameworks where it makes sense, while still understanding how each line in your codebase works
  • Willingness to work on QA and develop test automation scripts and participate in code reviews
  • Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively in a cross-functional team environment
  • Ethos of continuous improvement and interest in learning new things
  • Strong ability to understand and internalize the big picture and broader implications
  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skill with the ability to work with a diverse set of colleagues, across functions, from different organizations, disciplines, etc.
  • Self-starter, ability to set priorities, work independently and attain goals
  • AWS Certified (Associate or higher)

A minimum of 5 years' work related experience
Advanced experience working with Node.js in an AWS environment
Intermediate experience with React, and relational databases like PostgreSQL, or noSQL (such as DynamoDB)
Experienced implementing serverless applications on AWS
Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment
Experience working on Agile engineering teams
